conclusion: Determine final velocity v_t of electron when it exits electric field to find kinetic energy at point C.
Electron's initial velocity v_0 is 4 x 10^6 m/s and angle between initial and final velocity is 30 degrees.
Electron's velocity at point C can be decomposed into components v_x parallel and v_y perpendicular to initial velocity.
v_x = v_0 cos(30 degrees) and v_y = v_0 sin(30 degrees) from geometry of problem.
Trigonometric values: cos(30 degrees) = sqrt(3)/2, sin(30 degrees) = 1/2.
Calculate v_x: v_x = 4 x 10^6 x sqrt(3)/2 = 2 x 10^6 sqrt(3) m/s.
Calculate v_y: v_y = 4 x 10^6 x 1/2 = 2 x 10^6 m/s.
Magnitude of final velocity v_t is v_t = sqrt(v_x^2 + v_y^2).
Substitute values: v_t = sqrt((2 x 10^6 sqrt(3))^2 + (2 x 10^6)^2).
Calculate v_t: v_t = sqrt(12 x 10^12 + 4 x 10^12) = sqrt(16 x 10^12) = 4 x 10^6 m/s.
Kinetic energy K at point C is K = 1/2 m v_t^2.
Mass of electron m = 0.91 x 10^-30 kg.
Substitute values: K = 1/2 x 0.91 x 10^-30 x (4 x 10^6)^2.
Final kinetic energy K = 7.28 x 10^-18 J.
